definition: stride/to step (on the spot)/to mark time/at a standstill
to tread/to stamp/to step on/to press a pedal/to investigate on the spot
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
in big strides/(fig.) in giant steps
to be at a standstill/to mark time
to mark time (military)/to make no headway

sentences.english: If your children can't reach the sink on their own, keep a stepstool handy.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的孩子自己够不着洗手盆，就进放一张踏步凳。

sentences.english: Each careful step along the byway.
sentences.chinese: 在偏颇的路上小心翼翼地踏步。

sentences.english: An overhead view of the south stairs reveals the deference of the stairway to the topography.
sentences.chinese: 南部台阶的顶视图揭示了这些踏步对于地形的尊重。

sentences.english: The requirement for the United States Navy is to go ahead and execute sea control.
sentences.chinese: 对于美国海军的要求是大踏步前进，实施制海权。

sentences.english: Walking in Royal Garden will be defined as new improvement in your life culture.
sentences.chinese: 踏步御花苑，只是理解为生活文化即将再上新台阶。

sentences.english: The rest of America is stuck in neutral or reverse.
sentences.chinese: 其他美国人的状况则是原地踏步或在倒退。

sentences.english: His enemy turned and paraded from the chapel.
sentences.chinese: 他的敌人转身朝着礼拜堂踏步走去。

sentences.english: He paraded up the incline toward the church.
sentences.chinese: 他大踏步朝着教堂在斜坡上走着。

sentences.english: Tom steps forward and hugs and kisses Hoa.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆大踏步地前进，并拥抱和亲吻安和。

sentences.english: Use a belt sander to square the ends of a blank.
sentences.chinese: 用砂光机踏步两端的一项空白。

sentences.english: Steel ladders and pedals shall be provided in the water tanks and oil tanks according to the shipyard's standard.
sentences.chinese: 根据船厂标准，水舱和油舱安装钢质梯子和踏步。

sentences.english: Many fell out, aflame, burning and squealing on the steps.
sentences.chinese: 很多掉出来，燃烧着，在踏步上嚎叫。

sentences.english: With the running torrents of spring, the era is striding forward.
sentences.chinese: 春潮激涌，时代在大踏步向前迈进。

sentences.english: Near the center of the park, also called Tian Tan Park, about 150 people marched in place.
sentences.chinese: 在天坛公园的中央附近，约有150个人在原地踏步。

sentences.english: You cannot move forward until you start a savings program.
sentences.chinese: 除非你开始储蓄，否则你永远将原地踏步。

sentences.english: The footfall of form of its circular arc, it is the place with most complacent goodwife.
sentences.chinese: 其圆弧形的踏步，是女主人最为自得之处。

definition: in big strides/(fig.) in giant steps
to tread/to stamp/to step on/to press a pedal/to investigate on the spot
to mount (a horse, bike, flight of stairs, rickshaw etc)
at a stride/taking large steps (while walking)
